newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine cash soybeans slip after Chicago.
newsitem.headline: Argentine cash soybeans slip after Chicago.

text.p: Argentine soybeans weakened in slow cash market trade in the wake of lower Chicago prices, traders said.

Prices paid to farmers for soybeans in Rosario lost $4 to $298. Maize was mixed in good volume trade, with good demand by exporters to fill ships in port. Buenos Aires spot maize was unchanged at $112. May sunflower seed firmed $2 in medium volume, helped by good crush margins, to $220. Wheat rose in tight trade, helped higher by bad U.S. crop weather. Bahia Blanca wheatr rose $3 to $150.
